intro: Triteleia ixioides subsp. ixioides, commonly known as the slender triteleia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its slender stems and smaller, more delicate flowers compared to other triteleia species.
